Leonetti]] | producer = {{ubl|[[Peter Safran]]|[[James Wan]]}} | writer = [[Gary Dauberman]] | based on = [[Annabelle (doll)|The Annabelle doll]] | starring = {{Plainlist| * [[Annabelle Wallis]] * [[Ward Horton]] * [[Alfre Woodard]] }} | music = [[Joseph Bishara]] | cinematography = James Kniest | editing = Tom Elkins | studio = {{Plainlist| * [[New Line Cinema]] * [[RatPac Entertainment]] * [[Atomic Monster Productions]] * [[The Safran Company]] }} | distributor = [[Warner Bros. Pictures]] | released = {{Film date|2014|9|29|[[TCL Chinese Theatre]]|2014|10|03|United States}} | runtime = 98 minutes<!--Theatrical runtime: 98:38--><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/annabelle-film |title=''Annabelle'' (15) |work=[[British Board of Film Classification]] |date=September 26, 2014 |accessdate=September 26, 2014}}</ref> | country = United States | language = English | budget = $6.5{{nbsp}}million<ref name=BOM/> | gross = $257{{nbsp}}million<ref name=BOM>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=newlinehorror.htm |title=Annabelle (2014) |work=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=August 6, 2015}}</ref> }}
'''''Annabelle''''' is a 2014 American [[supernatural horror film]] directed by [[John R. Leonetti]], written by [[Gary Dauberman]] and produced by [[Peter Safran]] and [[James Wan]]. It is a [[prequel]] to 2013's ''[[The Conjuring]]'' and the second installment in [[The Conjuring Universe]]. The film was inspired by a story of a doll named [[Annabelle (doll)|Annabelle]] told by [[Ed and Lorraine Warren]].<ref name="Spin-Off">{{cite web |last=Reilly |first=Mark |title=''The Conjuring'' Gets a Spin-Off Movie with ''Annabelle''! |url=http://schmoesknow.com/the-conjuring-gets-a-spin-off-movie-with-annabell/ |accessdate=February 2, 2014 |work=Schmoes Know |date=November 8, 2013}}</ref> The film stars [[Annabelle Wallis]], [[Ward Horton]], and [[Alfre Woodard]].
''Annabelle'' premiered at the [[TCL Chinese Theatre]] in [[Los Angeles]] on September 29, 2014,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.upi.com/News_Photos/Entertainment/Annabelle-premiere-in-Los-Angeles/8613/ |title=Annabelle Premiere |work=[[United Press International]] |accessdate=September 30, 2014}}</ref> and was theatrically released in the United States on October 3, 2014.<ref name=release>{{cite web |title=Warner Bros Scheduling Spree Continues With ''The Conjuring 2'', ''Mean Moms'', 2 Others |url=http://www.deadline.com/2014/02/warner-bros-scheduling-spree-continues-with-the-conjuring-2-mean-moms-2-others/ |accessdate=February 26, 2014 |work=Deadline Hollywood |date=February 25, 2014}}</ref> The film received generally negative reviews from critics but was a box office success, grossing over $257{{nbsp}}million against its $6.5{{nbsp}}million production budget. A [[prequel]], titled ''[[Annabelle: Creation]]'', was released on August 11, 2017. A [[Untitled Annabelle film|currently untitled sequel]] will be released on July 3, 2019.
==Plot== In 1967 in [[Santa Monica, California|Santa Monica, CA]], John Form, a doctor, presents his expectant wife Mia with a rare vintage porcelain doll as a gift for their first child to be placed in a collection of dolls in their daughter's nursery.
That night, the couple is disturbed by the sounds of their next door neighbors, the Higgins, being murdered during a home invasion. While Mia calls the police, she and John are attacked by the Higgins' killers. The police arrive and shoot one killer, a man, dead while the female killer commits suicide by slitting her own throat inside the nursery while holding the porcelain doll. News reports identify the assailants as the Higgins' estranged daughter, Annabelle, and her unidentified boyfriend, both members of a cult.
In the days following the attack, a series of paranormal activities occur around the Form's residence. Afterwards, Mia gives birth to a healthy baby girl. She and John name their child Leah. The family rents an apartment in [[Pasadena, California|Pasadena]] and, after finding the doll that John had discarded since Annabelle's previous attack in one of their boxes, another set of paranormal events plagues Mia and her daughter. The next night, Mia is haunted by a malevolent presence in her apartment and believes it to be Annabelle's ghost. During a storm, Mia encounters an enigmatic figure in the building's basement who begins pursuing her before she escapes.
Mia calls back Detective Clarkin to gather information about Annabelle and the cultist and learns that the cult intends to [[Evocation|summon supernatural beings]]. With the help of bookseller and fellow tenant Evelyn, Mia realizes that the cult practiced [[Theistic Satanism|devil worship]], which summoned a [[demon]] who followed the family after they moved to their apartment in order to claim a soul. Upon returning home, Mia and Leah are attacked by the demon who reveals itself while manipulating the doll. Mia and John contact their parish priest, Father Perez, who informs them that demons sometimes attach themselves to inanimate objects as an advantage to accomplish their goals and that a human soul must be offered for a purpose. Without any hopes of exorcising the demon out of the doll, Father Perez decides to take it away to seek help from [[Ed and Lorraine Warren|the Warrens]] for investigation. But before he can enter the church, the demon impersonating Annabelle's spirit attacks him and grabs the doll.
The priest is hospitalized on the next day and, when John checks on him, Father Perez warns the latter that after sensing its powerful presence, the demon's true intention is to claim Mia's soul. That night, while Evelyn is visiting Mia, the demon uses Father Perez's physical form to sneak into the apartment and abduct Leah in exchange for her mother's soul. To spare her daughter, Mia attempts to jump out of the window with the doll but John arrives in time along with Evelyn to stop her. Evelyn decides to take her own life in Mia's place instead as atonement for causing a car accident that resulted in the death of her daughter Ruby years ago. As the Forms are reunited, the demon and the doll disappear, while Leah is safely inside her crib.
Six months later, the doll is bought from an antique shop by a mother as a gift for her daughter Debbie, one of the nursing students from the prelude of the [[The Conjuring|first film]].
==Cast== {{div col}} * [[Annabelle Wallis]] as Mia Form * [[Ward Horton]] as John Form * [[Alfre Woodard]] as Evelyn * [[Tony Amendola]] as Father Perez * Kerry O'Malley as Sharon Higgins<ref name="Sharon">{{cite web |title=Annabelle |url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/85087/85087/ |accessdate=October 31, 2014 |work=Film Music Reporter |date=September 17, 2014}}</ref> * [[Brian Howe (actor)|Brian Howe]] as Pete Higgins * [[Eric Ladin]] as Detective Clarkin * [[Ivar Brogger]] as Dr. Burgher * [[Gabriel Bateman]] as Robert * Shiloh Nelson as Nancy * Geoff Wehner as Neighbor * Tree O'Toole as Annabelle "Janice" Higgins ** Keira Daniels as 7-year-old Annabelle Higgins * Robin Pearson Rose as the Mother * Camden Singer as Clerk * Morganna May as Debbie * [[Amy Tipton]] as Camilla * Zach Pappas as Rick * Sasha Sheldon as Nurse * Christopher Shaw as Fuller * [[Joseph Bishara]] as Demon {{div col end}}
==Production==
===Development=== The film is a spin-off of the 2013 horror film ''[[The Conjuring]]'', focusing on the origins of the Annabelle doll found in that film. The film was designed to be stand alone yet at the same time catering to fans of "The Conjuring" who would already be familiar with the latter film.<ref name="Backstage"/> According to Backstage.com, the film was one of the first in a new strategy by distributors Warner Bros. and New Line Cinema "that capitalizes on the built-in fan bases for successful films, allowing for smaller budgets and production time with a bigger payout on the back end."<ref name="Backstage">{{cite web |last1=Rodriguez |first1=Briana |title=1 Strategy That Helps ''Annabelle'' Director John R. Leonetti |url=http://www.backstage.com/interview/1-strategy-helps-annabelle-director-john-r-leonetti/ |website=Backstage.com |accessdate=February 14, 2016}}</ref>
===Casting=== Casting was announced in January 2014, with [[Annabelle Wallis]] and [[Ward Horton]] playing the lead roles.<ref name=Leads>{{cite web |last=Sneider |first=Jeff |title=New Line's ''Conjuring'' Spinoff ''Annabelle'' Casts Its Leads |url=http://www.thewrap.com/new-lines-conjuring-sequel-annabelle-casts-leads-exclusive/ |accessdate=February 2, 2014 |website=[[TheWrap]] |date=January 15, 2014}}</ref> with actors [[Eric Ladin]], [[Brian Howe (actor)|Brian Howe]] and [[Alfre Woodard]] also being announced that month.<ref name=Alfre>{{cite web |last=McNary |first=Dave |title=Alfre Woodard Materializes in Horror-Thriller ''Annabelle'' |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/alfre-woodard-materializes-in-horror-thriller-annabelle-exclusive-1201078993/ |accessdate=February 2, 2014 |website=Variety |date=January 30, 2014}}</ref><ref name=TwoMore>{{cite web |last=Creepy |first=Uncle |title=Two More Actors To Be Haunted By Annabelle |url=http://www.dreadcentral.com/news/73607/2-more-haunted-annabelle |accessdate=February 2, 2014 |website=Dread Central |date=January 28, 2014}}</ref>
===Filming=== [[Principal photography]] began on January 27, 2014, at The Book Shop in [[Covina, California]].<ref name="Alfre"/><ref name="Filming in Covina">{{cite web |url=http://www.covinaca.gov/for-businesses/filming-in-covina |title=Archived copy |accessdate=September 25, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140919153105/http://www.covinaca.gov/for-businesses/filming-in-covina |archivedate=September 19, 2014}}</ref><ref name="Jan.27">{{cite web |last=McNary |first=Dave |title=''The Conjuring'' Spinoff ''Annabelle'' Starts Shooting Jan. 27 |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/the-conjuring-spinoff-annabelle-starts-shooting-jan-27-1201059109/ |accessdate=February 2, 2014 |website=Variety |date=January 15, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Bussey |first=Ben |title=The Conjuring spin-off Annabelle starts production |url=http://uk.movies.yahoo.com/conjuring-spin-off-annabelle-starts-production-160400075.html |accessdate=February 2, 2014 |website=Yahoo! Movies |date=January 31, 2014}}</ref> On February 25, 2014, filming continued at an apartment in [[Normandie Avenue|South Normandie Avenue]] in [[Los Angeles County]], where the 55-member crew shot for several days.<ref>{{cite web |last=Verrier |first=Richard |title=''Conjuring'' spinoff ''Annabelle'' is filming in Los Angeles |url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/envelope/cotown/la-et-ct-conjuring-spinoff-annabelle-location-production-los-angeles-20140225,0,5749489.story#axzz2uSKZXNiU |accessdate=February 26, 2014 |website=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=February 25, 2014}}</ref> Director Leonetti and producer Safran told reporters that the ''Annabelle'' set was "haunted" and that they thought "supernatural phenomena" had occurred there.<ref name=haunted>{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/annabelle-director-john-leonetti-talks-736762 |title=''Annabelle'' Director John Leonetti Talks About Shooting on a Haunted Set |last=Casas |first=Alyssa |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=September 30, 2014 |accessdate=October 12, 2014}}</ref> The film was shot in sequence so that the actors were always aware of their emotional arcs.<ref name="Backstage"/>
==Music== On April 24, 2014, [[Joseph Bishara]] was hired to compose the music for the film.<ref>{{cite news |title=Joseph Bishara Scoring ''Annabelle'' |url=http://filmmusicreporter.com/2014/04/24/joseph-bishara-scoring-annabelle/ |accessdate=October 31, 2014 |work=Film Music Reporter |date=April 24, 2014}}</ref> [[WaterTower Music]] released the soundtrack album on September 30, 2014.<ref>{{cite news |title=''Annabelle'' Soundtrack Details |url=http://filmmusicreporter.com/2014/09/17/annabelle-soundtrack-details/ |accessdate=October 31, 2014 |work=Film Music Reporter |date=September 17, 2014}}</ref>
==Reception==
===Box office=== ''Annabelle'' grossed $84.3{{nbsp}}million in North America and $172.8 in other territories, for a worldwide total of $257{{nbsp}}million, against a production budget of $6.5{{nbsp}}million.<ref name=BOM/> In the U.S. and Canada, ''Annabelle'' is the fourteenth highest-grossing horror/supernatural film.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/genres/chart/?id=supernaturalhorror.htm |title=Horror - Supernatural |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=December 7, 2014}}</ref>
Early tracking projected ''Annabelle'' would gross around $25–27{{nbsp}}million in its opening weekend. However, estimates declined shortly after to a range between $20–22{{nbsp}}million.<ref name=Pamela_McClintock>{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/entry/view/id/665602 |title=Box Office: Will David Fincher's ''Gone Girl'' Be Upstaged By a Demonic Doll? |first=Pamela |last=McClintock |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=September 30, 2014 |accessdate=September 30, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thewrap.com/annabelle-about-to-raise-the-dead-horror-movie-box-office/ |title=''Annabelle'' Is Ready to Raise the Dead Horror Movie Box Office |first=Todd |last=Cunningham |work=TheWrap |date=September 30, 2014 |accessdate=October 1, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://screenrant.com/gone-girl-annabelle-box-office-prediction/ |title=Box Office Prediction: ''Gone Girl'' vs. ''Annabelle'' |first=Chris |last=Agar |work=Screen Rant |date=October 1, 2014 |accessdate=October 1, 2014}}</ref><ref name="Scott Bowles">{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2014/10/gone-girl-annabelle-left-behind-box-office-844782/ |title=Box Office Preview: ''Gone Girl'', ''Annabelle'' To Dominate Weekend |first=Scott |last=Bowles |work=Deadline Hollywood |date=October 2, 2014 |accessdate=October 3, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/gone-girl-annabelle-in-dead-heat-at-weekend-box-office-1201318763/ |title=''Gone Girl'', ''Annabelle'' in Dead Heat at Weekend Box Office |first=Brent |last=Lang |date=October 1, 2014 |accessdate=October 2, 2014 |website=Variety}}</ref> ''Annabelle'' was released on October 3, 2014, in 3,185 theatres in North America.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/alltime/widest.htm?page=WIDEST&p=.htm |title=Widest Releases (or The 3,000+ Club) |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=October 3, 2014}}</ref> It topped the box office in its opening day earning $15.4{{nbsp}}million (including its $2.1{{nbsp}}million midnight previews).<ref name="Pamela_McClintock"/><ref>{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/ben-affleck-gone-girl-annabelle-opening-weekend-1201321282/ |title=''Gone Girl'' Headed for $38 Mil Weekend Win, ''Annabelle'' Tops Friday Box Office |first=Maane |last=Khatchatourian |website=Variety |date=October 4, 2014 |accessdate=October 5, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/news/box-office-annabelle-gone-girl-thursday-1201320352/ |title=Box Office: ''Annabelle'' Tops ''Gone Girl'' with $2.1{{nbsp}}Million Thursday Night |first=Dave |last=McNary |website=Variety |date=October 3, 2014 |accessdate=October 3, 2014}}</ref> In its traditional three-day opening the film debuted at #2 at the box office with $37.1{{nbsp}}million, at an average of $11,659 per theater from 3,185 theaters after a neck-and-neck competition against ''[[Gone Girl (film)|Gone Girl]]'' which earned $37.5{{nbsp}}million. The two releases were separated by $378,854.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3921&p=.htm |title=Weekend Report: Moviegoers Thrill to ''Gone Girl'', ''Annabelle'' This Weekend |first=Ray |last=Subers |work=Box Office Mojo |date=October 5, 2014 |accessdate=October 7, 2014}}</ref> Its opening weekend gross is the eleventh highest in October and the biggest for a horror genre film of 2014, surpassing ''[[The Purge: Anarchy]]''{{'}}s $28.9{{nbsp}}million opening. Dan Fellman, president of domestic distribution at Warner Bros., said about the opening box office performance, "we had a wonderful campaign for the film and a good date"; she added "being a spinoff of ''The Conjuring'' set it up really well and we just hit the right note."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2014/biz/news/box-office-gone-girl-annabelle-stun-with-big-debuts-1201321788/ |title=Box Office: ''Gone Girl'', ''Annabelle'' Stun With Big Debuts |first=Brent |last=Lang |website=Variety |date=October 5, 2014 |accessdate=October 6, 2014}}</ref> It is the second time that an October weekend has produced two $30{{nbsp}}million or more debuts; the first was in 2008: ''[[High School Musical 3]]'' ($42{{nbsp}}million) and ''[[Saw V]]'' ($31{{nbsp}}million).<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/scottmendelson/2014/10/05/weekend-box-office-gone-girl-scores-38m-and-annabelle-opens-to-37-2m/ |title=Weekend Box Office: ''Gone Girl'' Scores $38M, ''Annabelle'' Nabs $37.2M |first=Scott |last=Mendelson |work=Forbes |date=October 5, 2014 |accessdate=October 6, 2014}}</ref> According to [[Rentrak]], the opening weekend crowd was evenly split between female with 51% and under 25 years with 54%. The film closed down its theatrical run on December 18, 2014 and earned a total of $84,273,813 becoming the thirty-fifth highest-grossing movie of 2014 in the US.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/yearly/chart/?yr=2014 |title=2014 Domestic Grosses |work=Box Office Mojo |accessdate=January 1, 2015}}</ref>
The film was released in [[Russia]] on September 26, 2014, a week prior to its [[wide release]] and earned $2.1{{nbsp}}million on its opening weekend, debuting at No. 3 at the Russian box office.<ref name=russia>{{cite web |url=http://www.screendaily.com/5078022.article |title=Maze Runner adds $29m int'l |first=Jeremy |last=Kay |work=Screen Daily |date=September 28, 2014 |accessdate=September 30, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2014/09/equalizer-box-office-results-boxtrolls-841650/ |title=Box Office Final: ''The Equalizer'' $34.1M; ''Boxtrolls'' $17.2M For No. 3 Behind ''Maze Runner''{{'}}s $17.4M |first=Anita |last=Busch |website=Deadline Hollywood |date=September 29, 2014 |accessdate=September 30, 2014}}</ref> Overseas in its opening weekend the film earned $23.6{{nbsp}}million from nearly 3,300 screen and 39 foreign markets for a first-weekend worldwide total of $60.8{{nbsp}}million.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2014/10/international-box-office-gone-girl-bang-dracula-untold-annabelle-846119/ |title=Int'l Box Office Update: ''Breakup Buddies'' In Huge China Debut; ''Gone Girl'' A Beaut With $24.6M; ''Bang Bang'' Holsters $25.4M; More |first=Nancy |last=Tartagloine |work=Deadline Hollywood |date=October 5, 2014 |accessdate=October 6, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/entry/view/id/692912 |title=Box Office Final: David Fincher's ''Gone Girl'' Narrowly Beats ''Annabelle'' |first=Pamela |last=McClintock |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=October 7, 2014 |accessdate=October 7, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thewrap.com/annabelle-rakes-in-nine-times-its-production-budget-in-first-weekend-box-office/ |title=''Annabelle'' Rakes In Nine Times Its Production Budget in First Weekend Box Office |first=Todd |last=Cunningham |work=TheWrap |date=October 6, 2014 |accessdate=October 7, 2014}}</ref>
High openings of ''Annabelle'' internationally were reported in [[France]] ($3.4{{nbsp}}million), [[Brazil]] ($3{{nbsp}}million), the [[UK]] ($3.1{{nbsp}}million), [[Argentina]] ($1.2{{nbsp}}million), [[Spain]] ($1.45{{nbsp}}million) and [[Germany]] ($1.14{{nbsp}}million). In [[India]] ''Annabelle'' debuted at #2 behind Bollywood blockbuster ''[[Bang Bang!]]'' and collected $1.3{{nbsp}}million.<ref name="Jeremy Kay">{{cite web |url=http://www.screendaily.com/5078554.article |title=Dracula Untold grossed $33.9m from 42 territories as the early tally climbed to $62.6m. Separately Fox International executives said the company's box office has amassed more than $3bn for the year-to-date. |first=Jeremy |last=Kay |work=Screen Daily |date=October 12, 2014 |accessdate=October 13, 2014}}</ref><ref name="Jeremy Kay"/> It set an all-time opening record for a horror film in [[Peru]] with $1.34{{nbsp}}million which is also Warner Bros. second biggest opening weekend of all time there overall.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2014/10/international-box-office-fury-annabelle-hercules-happy-new-year-china-guardians-861602/ |title=Int'l Box Office: ''Annabelle'' Still A Doll With $26.5M Frame; ''Fury'' Wages $11.2M; ''Lucy'' Outmuscles ''Hercules'' In China; ''Guardians'' Warps To #3 On 2014 Global Hit List; More |first=Nancy |last=Tartaglione |work=Deadline Hollywood |date=October 26, 2014 |accessdate=October 27, 2014}}</ref> In [[Mexico]], the film earned $10.9{{nbsp}}million (including previews) on its opening weekend and broke the record for the biggest debut ever for a horror movie and the best 2D opening. Its opening weekend gross is also the third-biggest opening overall of 2014 behind ''[[Maleficent (film)|Maleficent]]'' and ''[[Transformers: Age of Extinction]]'' there. In total the film took 59% of the total market share.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3944&p=.htm |title=Around-the-World: ''Annabelle'' Rules In Mexico, ''Guardians'' Passes ''X-Men'' |first=Ray |last=Subers |work=Box Office Mojo |date=October 26, 2014 |accessdate=October 28, 2014}}</ref>
As of October 13, 2014, ''Annabelle'' has become the highest-grossing horror film in the [[Philippines]], earning over ₱121.33{{nbsp}}million. The film surpassed ''[[Insidious: Chapter 2]]''{{'}}s record (₱113{{nbsp}}million), doing so after 12 days of release.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.philstar.com/314190/show/a62f10dc4eddae6d9fd2dc9e72517186/? |title=''Annabelle'' now the highest-grossing horror film in Philippines |date=October 15, 2014 |accessdate=October 16, 2014}}</ref> The film has also become the highest-grossing horror movie in [[Lebanon]] after staying atop the box office for two weekends.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2014/10/international-box-office-fury-annabelle-hercules-happy-new-year-china-guardians-861602/ |title=Int'l Box Office Final: ''Happy New Year'' Uncorks Record Bollywood Bow; ''Annabelle'' Still A Doll With $26.2M; ''Lucy'' Outmuscles ''Hercules'' In China; More |first=Nancy |last=Tartaglione |work=Deadline Hollywood |date=October 27, 2014 |accessdate=November 2, 2014}}</ref>
===Critical response=== ''Annabelle'' received generally negative reviews from critics, the majority of which felt the film inferior to its [[The Conjuring|predecessor]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/moviesnow/la-et-mn-annabelle-movie-reviews-critics-20141002-story.html |title=''Annabelle'': Horror prequel scares up lackluster reviews |first=Oliver |last=Lackluster |work=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=October 3, 2014 |accessdate=January 16, 2015}}</ref> The [[review aggregator]] website [[Rotten Tomatoes]] reports an approval rating of 29% based on 125 reviews, with an [[Weighted arithmetic mean|average rating]] of 4.4/10. The site's critical consensus reads, "''Annabelle'' borrows unabashedly from better horror films, content to leave viewers with a string of cheap jolts that fail to build on the far more effective ''The Conjuring''."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/annabelle/ |title=Annabelle (2014) |work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] |accessdate=February 3, 2015}}</ref> On [[Metacritic]], the film has a weighted average score of 37 out of 100, based on 27 critics, indicating "generally unfavorable reviews".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/annabelle |title=Annabelle |work=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=February 3, 2015}}</ref> Audiences polled by [[CinemaScore]] gave the film a grade of "B" on an A+ to F scale.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cinemascore.com |title=CinemaScore |work=cinemascore.com}}</ref>
Frank Scheck of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' criticized the film for its cheap production and screenplay, but was positive towards the performances of the cast and saying, "the film is ultimately so scary and formulaic that you won't forget it."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movie/annabelle/review/737562 |title=''Annabelle'': Film Review |first=Frank |last=Scheck |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=October 2, 2014 |accessdate=January 16, 2015}}</ref>
Scott Foundas of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' gave the film a positive review, calling the film "inspired" but periodically cheap. He added "a cut-rate spinoff from James Wan's superlative haunted-house hit ''The Conjuring'' that (partly) makes up in crude shock effects, but lacks in atmosphere. Designed mainly as a starring vehicle for the eponymous, creepy-as-hell doll (who easily outclasses her human co-stars), this WB/New Line quickie is the thirst of die-hard genre fans and is by the far the best horror movie of the year".<ref>{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2014/film/reviews/film-review-annabelle-1201319522/ |title=Film Review: ''Annabelle'' |first=Scott |last=Foundas |website=Variety |date=October 2, 2014 |accessdate=October 3, 2014}}</ref>
Pete Hammond of ''[[Deadline Hollywood|Deadline]]'' gave the film a positive review and said that the scary doll show has left him pining for [[Chucky (Child's Play)|Chucky]] in ''[[Child's Play (1988 film)|Child's Play]]''. He further added, "''Annabelle'' may still draw horror fans in this Halloween month, and they will be quaking over the scares in this film."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2014/10/annabelle-review-the-conjuring-prequel-pete-hammond-845104/ |title=''Annabelle'' Review: Pete Hammond On Scary ''The Conjuring'' Prequel |last=Hammond |first=Pete |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date=October 2, 2014 |accessdate=October 12, 2014}}</ref>
==Prequel== {{main|Annabelle: Creation}} In October 2014, Fellman told ''[[The Washington Post]]'' that the studio was considering a film series based on the film, with a sequel already in the works.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/technology/2014/10/09/436984a0-4e4a-11e4-aa5e-7153e466a02d_story.html |title=The sums of all fear: Horror makes a Hollywood comeback |last=Kang |first=Cecillia |work=[[The Washington Post]] |date=October 9, 2014 |accessdate=October 19, 2014}}</ref> In October 2015, it was reported that Gary Dauberman would be returning to write the script.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2015/film/news/anabelle-sequel-moving-forward-new-line-1201620464/ |title=''Anabelle'' Sequel Moving Forward at New Line |website=Variety |first=Dave |last=McNary |date=October 16, 2015 |accessdate=October 17, 2015}}</ref> On March 22, 2016, Warner Bros. slated the film for release on May 19, 2017,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.slashfilm.com/live-by-night-release-date-2/ |title=Ben Affleck's ''Live By Night'' and ''Annabelle 2'' Get Release Dates |work=/Film |first=Angie |last=Han |date=March 22, 2016 |accessdate=March 22, 2016}}</ref> with ''[[Lights Out (2016 film)|Lights Out]]'' director [[David F. Sandberg]] directing the film.
In June 2016, [[Miranda Otto]] and [[Stephanie Sigman]] were cast to star in the prequel. The story centers on a dollmaker and his wife (Otto) whose daughter tragically dies. Twelve years later they decide to open their home to a nun (Sigman) and several girls from a shuttered orphanage. When the dollmaker’s possessed creation Annabelle sets her sights on the children, it turns their shelter into a storm of horror.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.comingsoon.net/movies/news/697665-annabelle-2-cast |title=Annabelle 2 Cast Adds Miranda Otto and Stephanie Sigman |date=June 22, 2016 |work=ComingSoon.net}}</ref>
==Sequel== {{main|Untitled Annabelle film}} In April 2018, Warner Bros. announced July 3, 2019, as the release date for an as-yet untitled new film in ''The Conjuring'' franchise.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://screenrant.com/conjuring-3-just-mercy-superintelligence-release-dates |title=New Conjuring Film, Just Mercy & More Set Release Dates |first=Sandy |last=Schaefer |date=April 20, 2018 |work=Screen Rant |access-date=April 28, 2018}}</ref> Later that month it was announced that the film will be a third ''Annabelle'' film, with Gary Dauberman signed on to write and direct, in his directorial debut. James Wan and Peter Safran will co-produce the project.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/annabelle-creation-sequel-works-gary-dauberman-directing-1106622 |title='Annabelle: Creation' Sequel in the Works With Gary Dauberman Directing (Exclusive) |author=Borys Kit |date=April 27, 2018 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |accessdate=April 28, 2018}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}

[[Image:Asociación Argentina de Intérpretes (logo).png|thumb|Official logo of AADI.]] The '''Argentine Interpreters Association''' ({{lang-es|Asociación Argentina de Intérpretes}}, AADI) is a non profit-making organisation that, since 1954, has been responsible for the collection, management and distribution of the performing rights of musicians in Argentina, enshrined in Article 56 of Law 11.723.
It is a member of the Federation of Ibero-Latin American Performers ({{lang-es|Federación Iberolatinoamericana de Artistas Intérpretes y Ejecutantes}}, FILAIE) which represents all sister organisations and forms a global network for the exchange of information, both as to the amounts generated and the rights managed.
==External links== *{{es icon}} [http://www.aadi-interpretes.org.ar Official website]
[[Category:Argentine music]]

revision.comment: Freeware version was first released in 2018, however a commercial version (which is a current product) will be published in 2018
revision.text:
{{Infobox video game | title = Armored Brigade | designer = Juha Kellokoski | developer = Veitikka Studios | publisher = [[Matrix Games]] | released = 2018 | genre = [[Real-time tactics]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] | platforms = [[Windows]] |image = Armored Brigade logo.jpg |caption = ''Armored Brigade'' logo |alt = Armored Brigade logo }} '''''Armored Brigade''''' is a real-time tactical wargame, focusing on realism and playability. The first incarnation of the game was published in 2008 and the most recent version was released in January 2016; marking last freeware version to be published. A commercial version, including drastic gameplay improvements, new features and reworked unit and terrain graphics is being actively developed with scheduled completion during the fall of 2018.
Players control individual tanks and vehicles from a top-down perspective, on a zoomable map. Infantry are mostly in squad/section sized units. The whole force under a player's control ranges from platoon level upwards, depending on battle options.
The games are single player against the AI.
==Gameplay== {| class="toccolours" style="float: right; margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em; font-size: 85%; background:#c6dbf7; color:black; width:23em; max-width: 25%;" cellspacing="5" | style="text-align: left;" |
June 18, 1987. Across a birch-dotted valley somewhere in Eastern Europe, a line of US APCs nervously scurry. The friendly scout teams on the wooded slopes ahead hear the rumble of thunder first, but by then it's much too late. Two MiG 21s are overhead in an instant, cluster bombs tumbling from their wings as they pass. In the welter of detonations, three APCs shudder to a halt. The surviving vehicles race for the treeline and disgorge their passengers while Vulcan mini-guns spew leaden fury at the fast-fleeing aircraft.
The first exchange in a typically tense Armored Brigade battle.
|- | style="text-align: left;" | ''[[Eurogamer]]''<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/more-priceless-victories-article|title=More Priceless Victories - Article|author=Tim Stone|publisher=Eurogamer|date=2010-07-19}}</ref> |}
Armored Brigade simulates modern combined-arms combat from platoon to regiment/brigade level from a top-down perspective. Freeware version only represented a hypothetical [[World War III]] scenario in 1987, while commercial edition covers all years from 1965 to 1991. Sides available are the US, USSR, West and East Germany, UK, Finland and Poland. There are plans to add more nations (freeware version had 11 nations, but limited to a single year) and open up the timescale, including [[World War II]].
Players can control individual vehicles, platoons and companies. Infantry is mostly in squad/section sized units. The game includes a wide variety of accurately researched and historical squads, weapons, vehicles, aircraft, and artillery.
Unit morale, experience level and fatigue, command delay, a wide set of weapon and vehicle parameters are all taken into account to produce realistic combat simulation.
A wide range of orders are available supplemented by a set of [[Standard Operating Procedure]]s, like different rates of fire, engagement ranges and dismount policy. Furthermore, units can be organized into nine formations, with customizable spacing between individual vehicles.
The current version of the game includes large real world terrain maps, representing areas likely to be involved in a [[Cold War]] engagement, including the [[Fulda Gap]] and [[North German Plain]].
Up to 0.801 beta version, maps could be randomly generated — either by the built-in map generator with a number of different settings or by an external tool like [[Terragen]] (from version 0.704a). Afterwards, real terrain maps were introduced, generated from satellite data. Their size can vary from 2x2 to 15x15 kilometres, on an area covering initially about 7,300 square kilometres, and soon afterwards increased to 30,000 square kilometres. Different terrain sets for summer, autumn and winter seasons are available. Also included are desert, tropical and "nuclear wasteland" sets. Real world elevation data can also be read by the game to generate accurate maps of anywhere in the world.
The game features a dynamic time of day and variable visibility, with the weather, including night and storm, influencing the battle and ground conditions. Other interesting features are [[Three-dimensional space|3D]] battlefield overview and civilian units.
The games are currently single player against the AI. The AI is able to analyse terrain both in offensive and defensive operations, and conduct manoeuvres according to one of predetermined routines - Armored, Mechanized or Infantry with emphasis placed on the corresponding unit type. new features make Armored Brigade definitely the most realistic Cold War themed tactical level wargame to date.
==Reception== The game has been widely praised by critics, even in its still early incarnation. It has been favourably compared to [[Steel Panthers]], [[Combat Mission (video game series)|Combat Mission Series]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rockpapershotgun.com/2008/03/30/armored-brigade/|title=Armored Brigade|author=Tim Stone|publisher=Rock, Paper, Shotgun|date=2008-03-30}}</ref> and the [[Close Combat series]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.peerpressureworks.com/2008/11/16/look-ma-not-every-goddamn-game-is-a-50-drm-riddled-disaster/ |title=Look, Ma, Not Every Goddamn Game is a $50 DRM-Riddled Disaster! |author=Geektastic |publisher=Peer Pressure Works |date=2008-11-16 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110419063116/http://www.peerpressureworks.com/2008/11/16/look-ma-not-every-goddamn-game-is-a-50-drm-riddled-disaster/ |archivedate=2011-04-19 }}</ref> [[Computer and Video Games|CVG]] said "hides convincing Cold War combat drama under unassuming 2D top-down visuals."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/203749/features/complimentary-campaigning/|title=Complimentary Campaigning|author=Tim Stone|publisher=CVG|date=2008-11-16}}</ref> By 2013, game was reviewed and positively rated among others by Eurogamer.dk and Ekstra Bladet, the biggest newspaper in Denmark. <ref>{{cite web|url=http://ekstrabladet.dk/kup/elektronik/spil/article4737309.ece|title=Krigsspil: Warszawa-Pagten mod NATO|author=Martin Wiinholt|publisher=Ekstra Bladet|date=2013-03-24}}</ref>
==Modding== From 0.697c onward, all data base entries are externalized in [[XML]] format and thus are open for [[modding]]. Small mods are already available at official forum and more can be expected as game reaches version 1.0. Commercial version will include full editor.
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.armoredbrigade.com/}}

revision.text:
{{Use South African English|date=September 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Orphan|date=August 2014}}
The '''Boswell Wilkie Circus''' was in business for close to 75 years in South Africa.<ref name="News 24">{{cite web|title=Boswell Wilkie Circus to close|url=http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/Boswell-Wilkie-Circus-to-close-20010917|publisher=News 24|accessdate=6 August 2014}}</ref>
==Circus origins== The Boswell family started the show in 1913 in [[Vrededorp, Gauteng|Vrededorp]], a [[Johannesburg]] suburb. The family did most of the entertainment. Jim, Walter and Alf did tumbling acts while Walter and Alf were clowns. Jim leaped from the springboard over ten ponies and they showed ponies, donkeys and dogs.<ref name="Circus Federation">{{cite web|last1=Ricketts|first1=Charles|title=The Boswells: The Story of a South African Circus|url=http://www.circusfederation.org/uploads/circus_culture/about/southafrica_boswells.pdf|publisher=Circus Federation|accessdate=6 August 2014}}</ref> It was one of the first shows to allow racially mixed audiences and it became a staple in South Africa. It was one of the first to defy the [[apartheid]] government's ban on Sunday entertainment. Wilkie's daughter Susie began performing when she was three and her brother, Robert, was the youngest person to become a circus director and manager.<ref name="News 24" />
==First World War== During the First World War, the circus didn't perform much. From 1916 and after, the Boswells became known as the Boswell Brothers Circus and Menagerie, and they would eventually be called just the Bowsell's Circus.<ref name="Circus Federation" />
==Between the wars==
In 1919, the Boswells had their first show since the war in Durban. The Boswells started to put effort into enlarging their circus. The first [[Asian elephant]] was bought in 1921 from Frank Willison, an American who had a circus in [[Madagascar]]. Jim also started training his first lion group.<ref name="Circus Federation" /> In 1924 Boswell’s Circus undertook a tour that took them through Southern and Northern Rhodesia (now [[Zimbabwe]] and [[Zambia]]), [[Mozambique]], and up into the Belgian Congo for the first time.<ref name="Circus Federation" /> In 1932, during the worldwide recession, the Boswells held special charity performances in [[Durban]]. They gave a show in aid of the unemployed with the patronage of the Governor-General and the Countess of Clarendon.<ref name="Circus Federation" /> They also allowed unemployed people to sleep in the tent and they put on a performance for 1000 poor children and the elderly.
==Second World War== In 1941 there was great interest in the 21-year-old Helen Ayres of Pretoria. She handled the lions with great courage. She was the wife of Stanley, having married him in 1939.<ref name="Circus Federation" /> Three of the four original Boswell brothers retired in 1942.
==After the war== In 1953, the Boswell family entered into an agreement with the African Consolidated Theatres Organization.<ref name="Circus Federation" /> In November 1963, Jim and Syd Boswell sold the rest of their shares to the African Theatres. The terms of the settlement included that it would now be known as the Boswell-Wilkie Circus.
==Circus closing== The Boswell Wilkie Circus had its final show in October 2001. After difficult economic times in South Africa, the circus announced that the touring side would stop. Their final performance was on 13 October in [[Alberton, Gauteng]]. The circus then moved to [[Randvaal]]. The circus continued to perform just for corporate functions and Christmas parties.<ref name="News 24" />
==Taking down of the Big Top Tent at Randvaal== The below is a post from their website as a last good bye: It is with great sadness that the Wilkie family have to announce that after many years of the Big top standing on the Boswell Wilkie Circus farm in Randvaal, the beloved Big Top, that holds so many precious memories for those young and old, will be taken down on 10 December 2015.
After years under the hot South African sun, the circus Big Top has seen its last days in the spotlight and will unfortunately be retiring. The family have made the difficult decision not to replace the Big Top, which means that they will no longer have circus participation parties and school outings. We will, however, continue to host parties in the beautiful gardens of Café du Cirque, as well as in our newly renovated rustic stables venue, where the kiddies can enjoy the jungle gym, pony rides or perhaps even a clown. We do have a few tricks up our sleeves and we are currently working on a new project for children’s parties. Updates will be posted on the Café du Cirque Facebook page.
The Wilkie’s are still, however, keeping the circus alive, and have a vast variety of performers available for private and corporate events.
We encourage you all to come and say your nostalgic goodbyes and take your last photographs with our beautiful Italian Big Top. We are open Tuesdays – Fridays from 10h00 to 17h00, and Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays from 08h00 to 17h00.
==References== {{reflist}}
{{authority control}}
[[Category:Circuses]]

{{Infobox concert tour | concert_tour_name = Brava Tour | image = File:Lali Brava Tour.png | image_size = 250px | border = yes | artist = [[Lali Espósito|Lali]] | album = ''[[Brava (Lali Espósito album)|Brava]]'' | start_date = {{Start date|2018|8|23}} | end_date = | number_of_legs = 1 | number_of_shows = {{plainlist| *17 in Latin America *17 in Total }} | last_show = [[Lali en Vivo]]
(2017–2018) | this_show = '''Brava Tour'''
(2018–2019) | next_show = }} '''Brava Tour''' is the ongoing fourth headlining concert tour by Argentine singer [[Lali Espósito]], in support of her third studio album, ''[[Brava (Lali Espósito album)|Brava]]'' (2018). The tour began on August 23, 2018, in [[Buenos Aires]]. ==Background== Following the release of her single "[[100 Grados]]", In April 2018 Lali announced that she was going to tour later that year. While still touring with her [[Lali en Vivo]], a second date at the [[Estadio Luna Park|Luna Park Arena]] had to be added due to high demand. Argentine, Uruguayan and Chilean dates were announced in the following weeks.{{cite web|url=https://www.filo.news/espectaculos/Lali-Esposito-anuncio-las-fechas-de-su-proxima-gira-20180615-0054.html|title=Lali Espósito anunció las fechas de su próxima gira|accessdate=24 August 2018|date=15 June 2018|work=Filo News|language=Spanish}}{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/latin/8470843/lali-esposito-new-album-brava-track-by-track-review-interview|title=Lali Esposito Talks New Album, 'Brava,' & Track by Track Review|accessdate=24 August 2018|date=17 August 2018|work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|first=Santiago|last=Torres}}{{cite web|url=https://www.mundotkm.com/globalmusica/2018/06/14/lali-esposito-brava-tour/|title=Lali Espósito arranca el Brava Tour en agosto|accessdate=24 August 2018|work=TKM|language=Spanish}} ==Concert synopsis== The show begins when a video introduction is displayed on the huge vertical [[LED display|LED screen]]. The stage simulates to be a garden of eight meters high and sixteen meters wide, surrounded by gigantic [[Rose|roses]] and lips, representing the aesthetics of the album. After the phrase "Soy brava, babies" (English: "I'm fierce, babies") is heard, Lali appears onstage wearing a golden sequin [[Bodysuit|bodysuit]] and a fringed jacket to perform "OMG!". The first set also includes "[[A Bailar (Lali Espósito song)|A Bailar]]", "[[Histeria (song)|Histeria]]", "Irresistible" and "[[Soy (song)|Soy]]". Lali changes her clothes to perform "Besarte Mucho", accompanied by a sexy choreography. Then, she performs "Somos Amantes", while images of her legs and her body are seen on the main screen. Previous to "Salvaje", she performs a sexy solo dance number on top of rotating platform. After "[[Sin Querer Queriendo]]", Lali performs [[Dance music|dance]] remixes of "[[Boomerang (Lali Espósito song)|Boomerang]]", "[[Mil Años Luz (Lali Espósito song)|Mil Años Luz]]", "Mi Religión" and "[[Asesina (Lali Espósito song)|Asesina]]", and leaves the stage. The party mood slows down as Lali reappears onstage wearing a long dress and accompanied by a piano to perform "Reina", "[[Unico (song)|Unico]]" and "Vuelve a Mi". Lali's back up dancers perform a dance interlude while their names appears on the screen. Once again, Lali comes back to the stage to perform "[[100 Grados]]". For "Tu Revolución", the lights of the arena turn green as a symbol of the [[Abortion in Argentina|pro-legal abortion movement in Argentina]].{{cite web|url=http://www.rollingstone.com.ar/2165369-el-panuelazo-verde-de-lali-en-el-luna-park|title=El pañuelazo verde de Lali en el Luna Park|first=Gabriel|last=Orqueda|work=[[Rolling Stone (magazine)|Rolling Stone Argentina]]|date=24 August 2018|accessdate=24 August 2018|language=Spanish}} As Lali performs "Bomba" and "[[Caliente (Lali song)|Caliente]]", the mood rises again. Following "Mi Última Canción" and "[[Una Na]]", Lali appears onstage wearing a long-champagne color dress to perform an acoustic set of her ballads "Tu Sonrisa", "Cielo Salvador", "Cree en Mí" and "[[Del Otro Lado (Lali Espósito song)|Del Otro Lado]]". When the show seems to have finished, Lali returns once again to perform "[[Ego (Lali Espósito song)|Ego]]", "[[No Estoy Sola]]" and "Amor Es Presente", wearing pink top and skirt. After two and a half hours, and having performed thirty-one songs, Lali performs "Tu Novia" while confetti rains from the ceiling. She disappears from the stage from the last time, and the big screen displays the word "Brava", indicating that the show has finished.{{cite web|url=https://www.clarin.com/espectaculos/musica/nueva-lali-esposito-hizo-explotar-luna_0_rkHuvxpLQ.html|title=La nueva Lali Espósito hizo explotar el Luna|work=[[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín]]|date=24 August 2018|accessdate=24 August 2018|language=Spanish}}{{cite web|url=https://www.diarioshow.com/musica/La-gran-bestia-brava-pop-20180824-0009.html|title=La gran bestia brava pop|work=DiarioShow|date=24 August 2018|accessdate=24 August 2018|language=Spanish}}{{cite web|url=https://www.lanacion.com.ar/2165317-lali-esposito-mas-brava-nunca-flasheo-su|title=Lali Espósito, más brava que nunca, "flasheó" a su público en el Luna Park|last=Talesnik|first=Tamara|work=[[La Nación]]|accessdate=24 August 2018|date=24 August 2018|language=Spanish}} ==Repertorio== This set list is representative of the show on August 23, 2018 in Buenos Aires, Argentina. {{Div col|colwidth=30em}} #"OMG!" #"[[A Bailar (Lali Espósito song)|A Bailar]]" #"[[Histeria (song)|Histeria]]" {{small|(interlude with elements of "Mi Religión", "[[Mil Años Luz (Lali Espósito song)|Mil Años Luz]]" and "[[Asesina (Lali Espósito song)|Asesina]]")}} #"Mi Religión" #"[[Mil Años Luz (Lali Espósito song)|Mil Años Luz]]" #"[[Asesina (Lali Espósito song)|Asesina]]" {{small|(remix)}} #"Reina" #"[[Unico (song)|Unico]]" #"Vuelve a Mi" #"[[100 Grados]]" #"Tu Revolución" #"Bomba" #"[[Caliente (Lali song)|Caliente]]" #"Mi Última Canción" #"[[Una Na]]" #"Tu Sonrisa" #"Cielo Salvador" #"Cree en Mí" #"[[Del Otro Lado (Lali Espósito song)|Del Otro Lado]]" #"[[Ego (Lali Espósito song)|Ego]]" #"[[No Estoy Sola]]" #"Amor Es Presente" #"Tu Novia" {{div col end}} {{hidden | headercss = background: #FFE6FF; font-size: 100%; width: 95%; | contentcss = text-align: left; font-size: 100%; width: 95%; | [[Mau y Ricky]] to perform "[[Sin Querer Queriendo]]" and "[[Mi Mala#Remix|Mi Mala (Remix)]]". * During the shows in Buenos Aires, Lali was joined onstage by [[Pabllo Vittar]] to perform "[[Caliente (Lali song)|Caliente]]". Vittar also performed "Problema Seu" alone.{{cite web|url=http://portalpopline.com.br/em-show-na-argentina-pabllo-vittar-e-lali-fazem-primeira-apresentacao-ao-vivo-de-caliente/|title=Em show na Argentina, Pabllo Vittar e Lali fazem a primeira apresentação ao vivo de “Caliente”|first=Kavad|last=Madeiros|work=POPline|date=24 August 2018|accessdate=24 August 2018|language=Portuguese}} }} ==Shows== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of concerts, showing date, city, country, venue, opening acts, tickets sold, amount of available tickets, and gross revenue |- ! revision.text:
{{update|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox website | name = Cambio | logo = Cambio.com logo.svg | logocaption = Cambio website logo | screenshot = | collapsible = | collapsetext = |launched = 2010 | caption = | url = {{URL|http://www.cambio.com}} | commercial = Yes | type = Entertainment News | registration = Optional | country = United States | language = {{unbulleted list | English }} | num_users = 7 million per month | content_license = | parent = [[AOL]] (2012–2017)
[[Oath Inc.]] (2017–present) |owner = | author = | editor = Linda Friedman | launch_date = | alexa = 9,946 | revenue = | current_status = Online | footnotes = }} '''Cambio''' is a pop culture website for primarily for female millennials - "for girls, #builtbygirls", owned and operated by [[Oath Inc.]]. Cambio launched in 2010 as a partnership between AOL, the Jonas Group and MGX lab as a next-generation MTV-like video network.{{cite news|last=Stelter|first=Brian|title=MTV Serves as Model for AOL Site|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/06/14/technology/internet/14aolcambio.html|newspaper=New York Times|date=13 June 2010}} In 2012, AOL fully acquired Cambio and in 2014 relaunched it in tandem with a partnership with [[Girls Who Code]] when five teenage graduates of the program joined the site as paid interns and helped shape Cambio's editorial mission{{cite web|title=About Cambio|url=http://www.cambio.com/about-us/|publisher=AOL}} and site design, as well as doing actual coding.{{cite news|last=Heyman|first=Marshall|title=Talking Taylor Swift With Three Girls Who Code|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/talking-taylor-swift-with-three-girls-who-code-1414618576|newspaper=The Wall Street Journal|date=29 October 2014}} During the six-week assignment, the girls focused on two projects: developing a "Celebspiration" meme generator and creating a platform called "Col[lab]" that encourages young women to write articles on any topic for the site.{{cite news|last=Rosenbaum|first=Sophia|title=Girls Who Code helps five young women excel as interns|url=https://nypost.com/2014/10/27/girls-who-code-helps-five-young-women-excel-as-interns/|newspaper=The Wall Street Journal|date=27 October 2014}} Cambio sees approximately 7.5 million unique views a month from a predominately 13 to 34-year-old audience.{{cite news|last=Strugatz|first=Rachel|title=AOL Partners With Girls Who Code|url=http://www.wwd.com/media-news/digital/aol-partners-with-girls-who-code-7841981|newspaper=Women's Wear Daily|date=19 August 2014}} ==Divisions== *News - Covering entertainment, tech, beauty, fashion, advice and music *Celebspiration - An inspirational quote "meme" generator *Col[lab] - A lab for young writers to develop their voice ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.cambio.com}} {{Oath Inc.}} [[Category:Entertainment websites]] [[Category:American blogs]] [[Category:News aggregators]] {{entertainment-website-stub}}

{{Multiple issues| {{Orphan|date=June 2015}} {{unreferenced|date=May 2015}} }}
A '''clarinet trio''' is a [[Chamber music|chamber ensemble]] that consists of a [[clarinet]], a [[Bow (music)|bowed]] [[string instrument]] and a [[piano]], or a [[Musical composition|musical work]] for such an ensemble. The string instrument can be a [[cello]], a [[viola]], or a [[violin]]. Therefore, a clarinet trio can be referred to below: * [[Clarinet-cello-piano trio]] * [[Clarinet-viola-piano trio]] * [[Clarinet-violin-piano trio]]
== Notable works for clarinet trio ==
=== Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart === * [[Kegelstatt Trio|Clarinet Trio in E-flat major, K. 498 "Kegelstatt-Trio"]]
=== Ludwig van Beethoven === * [[Piano Trio, Op. 11 (Beethoven)|Clarinet Trio in B-flat major, Op. 11 "Gassenhauer-Trio"]] * Clarinet Trio in E-flat major, Op. 38 (an arrangement of his [[Septet (Beethoven)|Septet]]) The clarinet part of both works by Beethoven can be and is often substituted with a violin.
=== Johannes Brahms === * [[Clarinet Trio (Brahms)|Clarinet Trio in A minor, Op. 114]]
=== Darius Milhaud === * Suite for violin, clarinet and piano, Op. 157b (1936)
=== Béla Bartók === * [[Contrasts (Bartók)|''Contrasts'', for clarinet, violin, and piano, Sz. 111, BB 116 (1938)]]
{{Musical ensembles}}
[[Category:Musical trios|*Clarinet]] [[Category:Chamber music]] [[Category:Types of musical groups]] [[Category:Compositions for clarinet]]
{{music-stub}}

{{Other people|Dennis Taylor}} {{Blacklisted-links|1= *http://cuetracker.net/Players/Dennis-Taylor/Career-Total-Statistics *:''Triggered by \bcuetracker\.net\b on the local blacklist'' *http://www.cuetracker.net/tournaments/pontins-camber-sands-open/1980/2417 *:''Triggered by \bcuetracker\.net\b on the local blacklist'' *http://www.prosnookerblog.com/media/television/clive-everton/ *:''Triggered by \bprosnookerblog\.com\b on the local blacklist''|bot=Cyberbot II|invisible=true}} {{BLP sources|date=May 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2015}} {{Use British English|date=May 2012}} {{Infobox snooker player | name = Dennis Taylor | image = Dennis Taylor, 2004.jpg | image_size = 200px | caption = Dennis Taylor in 2004 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1949|1|19|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Coalisland]], [[County Tyrone]], Northern Ireland | Sport country = {{flagcountry|Northern Ireland}} | Professional = 1972–2000 | High ranking = 2 ([[Snooker world rankings 1979/1980|1979/1980]]) | Prize money = £1,426,294http://cuetracker.net/Players/Dennis-Taylor/Career-Total-Statistics | High break = '''141''': 1987 Carling Challenge | Century break = 79http://cuetracker.net/Players/Dennis-Taylor/Career-Total-Statistics | Best finish = | Ranking wins = 2 | Other wins = 17 | World champ = [[World Snooker Championship 1985|1985]] }} '''Dennis Taylor''' (born '''Denis Taylor''', 19 January 1949 in [[Coalisland]], [[County Tyrone]], [[Northern Ireland]]) is a retired professional [[snooker]] player and current [[BBC]] snooker commentator. Winner of two [[Snooker world rankings|ranking events]], he is best known for winning the [[1985 World Snooker Championship final|1985 World Championship]], beating [[List of world number one snooker players|World number one]] [[Steve Davis]] on the final black in one of the sport's most memorable finals. He also won the [[Grand Prix (snooker)|Grand Prix]] in 1984 and the [[Masters (snooker)|Masters]] in 1987. Taylor is also well known for his sense of humour and his trademark oversized spectacles.{{citeweb|title=Snooker legend Dennis Taylor to meet East Lancashire teenagers|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/news/10631771.Snooker_legend_Dennis_Taylor_to_meet_East_Lancashire_teenagers/|accessdate=6 December 2017}} He made regular appearances on the snooker game show ''[[Big Break]]''. ==Career== ===Early career=== Taylor turned professional in 1972 and made his world championship debut in [[World Snooker Championship 1973|1973]], narrowly losing to [[Cliff Thorburn]] in the first round.{{cite web|title=Past Masters: Dennis Taylor|url=http://www.globalsnookercentre.co.uk/files/Players/Global_Europe/Global_Ireland/ni_dennis_taylor.htm|publisher=Global Snooker Centre|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080222215337/http://www.globalsnookercentre.co.uk/files/Players/Global_Europe/Global_Ireland/ni_dennis_taylor.htm|archivedate=22 February 2008}} After world semi-final losses in 1975 and 1977, Taylor reached his first major final – the World Championship – in [[World Snooker Championship 1979|1979]], but lost 24–16 to debutant [[Terry Griffiths]].{{World Snooker|senior|13165~2234125,00|30 March 2011}} Having reached the semi final of the World Championships in 1984, losing to Steve Davis, Taylor was playing very well as he began the 1984–85 season. In September, however, he was devastated by the sudden death of his mother, which caused him to withdraw from the Jameson International. His first ranking event win came later in 1984, when he won the [[Grand Prix (snooker)|Rothmans Grand Prix]] by beating [[Cliff Thorburn]] 10–2 in the final. ===The 1985 final=== Later that season he reached his second world final in [[1985 World Snooker Championship final|1985]], where he faced Steve Davis, world number one, reigning world champion and the dominant player of the 1980s. Taylor trailed 0–8 after the first session, but bounced back to trail 7–9 and 15–17 and then level at 17–17. In an incredibly tense final frame, the score was 62–44 to Davis with only the brown, blue, pink and black still on the table. While Davis needed only the brown, Taylor needed all the colours. He potted a long brown, which he says was one of his best ever shots under pressure. A tricky blue and a difficult pink also went in, bringing the score to 62–59 to ensure that, for the first time ever, the title would be decided on the black ball. Taylor eventually potted the black after Davis had missed a tricky cut into the top pocket and, amid euphoric scenes watched by over 18 million viewers well after midnight on live BBC television, took the title at the relatively advanced age of 36. Davis later drily commented that the match had all been there "in black and white". The World Championship win added to Taylor's popularity. On his return to Coalisland with the world trophy he was mobbed by the town's inhabitants, and he appeared widely on television thereafter. ===Later career=== Taylor reached the [[Grand Prix (snooker)|Rothmans Grand Prix]] final again in autumn 1985, and again faced Davis in a match that went to a deciding frame, but this time was beaten 10–9. As with all other first-time world champions so far, Taylor succumbed to the "[[Crucible curse]]" on his return to the [[Crucible Theatre]] [[World Snooker Championship 1986|the following year]] and lost 10–6 to [[Mike Hallett]] in the opening match, humorously acknowledging defeat by putting his handkerchief on the end of his cue to resemble a [[white flag]]. He won the [[Masters (snooker)|Benson & Hedges Masters]] in 1987, beating [[Alex Higgins]] 9–8 in the final, having trailed 8-5. Taylor often credits his comeback win to having heard that Higgins's manager had ordered a [[Wall's (ice cream)|Wall's]] [[Viennetta]] to celebrate their impending victory.{{citation needed|date=May 2015}} Taylor had a well-publicized row with Higgins at the 1990 snooker World Cup in which the Northern Ireland team were beaten by Canada in the final, which ended with Higgins threatening to have Taylor shot, a threat Taylor understandably took seriously since he and Higgins belonged to opposite sides of Northern Ireland's [[sectarianism|sectarian]] [[The Troubles|divide]]. Shortly afterwards they met in the quarter-finals of the [[1990 Irish Masters|Irish Masters]], and a determined Taylor won 5–2. The match was attended by a young [[Ken Doherty]]. Taylor also beat [[Jimmy White]] 6–5 in the semi-finals but, emotionally drained by the Higgins match, lost 9–4 to Davis in the final. Taylor and Higgins were later reconciled. Taylor and Davis met in the World Championship for a second time in 1991, this time in the quarter-finals. Davis won this match 13-7 to advance to the semi-final. Taylor was renowned for the glasses he wore during matches, with their large frame and unusual 'upside-down' structure that is required to avoid a player looking over the top of the lenses when down on a shot. As a member of the [[Matchroom]] group of players (managed by promoter [[Barry Hearn]]), Taylor performed on the hit single with [[Chas & Dave]], "[[Snooker Loopy]]", which peaked at #5 in the UK singles chart. His perceived bad eyesight was parodied in the song with the lines ''"them long shots, he never ever got. Why the old mind boggles. But nowadays he pots the lot"'' with Taylor himself singing ''"'cos I wear these goggles"''. He was also one of the first players to develop a relative competence in using his left hand to play the game, though he himself said this was partly because he hated to play shots with the rest. Taylor's form deteriorated at quite a pace in the 1990s and he dropped out of the top 16 after the [[1994 World Snooker Championship|1994 World Championship]], the last remaining player who had been in the original world rankings in 1976. He retired from playing in 2000 telling the [[BBC]] "I've had enough of this filthy game. I can now concentrate on my passion which is breathing heavily on false teeth. Tee hee". ===Personal life=== Taylor now commentates on the three televised snooker tournaments each year for the [[BBC]] and is known for his bona fide and light-hearted commentary. His most famous commentary incident occurred in 1998 when co-commentator [[Clive Everton]] nearly strangled Taylor after instinctively grabbing his tie as he fell off his chair.[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rrUYFNHcJEQ YouTube video of the Everton necktie incident with interview] Everton wrongly believed one snooker was required by a player before Taylor stated correctly that he actually needed three snookers to get back into the frame. Everton subsequently proclaimed that his "''brains have gone completely''" before leaning back in his chair which then gave way. He reached out as he fell, grabbing Taylor's tie and pulling him down with him. An audible bang rang around the auditorium as Everton fell off his chair and out the commentary box with Taylor laughing uncontrollably.{{Cite web |title=Clive Everton |url=http://www.prosnookerblog.com/media/television/clive-everton/ |work=prosnookerblog.com |accessdate=30 April 2014}} Taylor has also made guest appearances on [[Big Break]], [[They Think It's All Over (TV series)|They Think It's All Over]], [[Russian Roulette (game show)|Russian Roulette]], [[A Question of Sport]], [[The Weakest Link]] and [[The Sooty Show]]. In 2005, he was one of the celebrities taking part in the third series of the successful BBC show [[Strictly Come Dancing]], reaching eighth place with his partner Izabela Hannah. In February 1990, Taylor officially opened the ''[[Royal Mail]] [[Sorting office|Sorting Office]]'', in [[Blackburn, Lancashire|Blackburn]], Lancashire, giving it his own stamp of approval. He then took part in a one-frame friendly challenge match.{{cite web|url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/news/6092996.TEN_YEARS_AGO__Royal_Mail_on_cue/|title=TEN YEARS AGO: Royal Mail on cue|date=February 15, 2000|accessdate=July 31, 2016}} Taylor currently lives in [[Llay]] near [[Wrexham]] and has been a resident of the village since April 2003. His son Damien is a professional golf coach. His autobiography is entitled ''Frame By Frame''. ==Performance and rankings timeline==

An '''epic catalogue''' is a long, detailed list of objects, places or people that is a characteristic of [[epic poetry]].
== Examples == *In ''[[The Faerie Queene]]'', the list of trees I.i.8-9. *In ''[[Paradise Lost]]'', the list of demons in Book I.<ref name="quint">{{cite journal|last=Quint|first=David|date=Spring 2007|title=Milton's Book of Numbers: Book 1 of Paradise Lost and Its Catalogue|journal=International Journal of the Classical Tradition|volume=13|issue=4|pages=528–549|doi=10.1007/bf02923024|jstor=30222176}}</ref> *In the ''[[Aeneid]]'', the list of enemies the Trojans find in Etruria in Book VII. Also, the list of ships in Book X.<ref>{{cite book|editor=Christine Perkell|title=Reading Vergil's Aeneid: An Interpretative Guide|url=http://www.oupress.com/ECommerce/Book/Detail/909/reading%20vergil%20s%20aeneid|series=Oklahoma Series in Classical Culture|volume=23|year=1999|publisher=University of Oklahoma Press|isbn=9780806131399|pages=190–194}}</ref> *In the ''[[Iliad]]'':<ref>{{cite journal|last=Gaertner|first=Jan Felix|year=2001|title=The Homeric Catalogues and Their Function in Epic Narrative|journal=[[Hermes (publication)|Hermes]]|volume=129|pages=298–305|jstor=4477439}}</ref> **[[Catalogue of Ships]], the most famous epic catalogue **[[Trojan Battle Order]]
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:Rhetorical techniques]] [[Category:Narrative techniques]] [[Category:Epic poetry]]

'''Executive producer''' ('''EP''') is one of the top positions in the making of a commercial [[entertainment]] product. Depending on the [[media (communication)|medium]], the executive producer may be concerned with [[management accounting]] or associated with legal issues (like [[copyright]]s or [[royalties]]).<ref name=imdb>{{cite web|title=Typically an executive producer may handle business and legal issues|url=https://www.imdb.com/glossary/E#executive_producer|accessdate= March 10, 2013}}</ref> In films, the executive producer generally contributes to the [[Film budgeting|film's budget]] and usually does not work on set, in contrast to most other [[film producer|producer]]s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wisegeek.org/what-is-an-executive-producer.htm |title=What is an Executive Producer? |website=WiseGEEK |accessdate=2014-01-21}}</ref>
== Motion pictures == {{main|Film producer}} In films, executive producers [[film finance|finance]] the film or participate in the creative effort, but do not work on the set. Their responsibilities vary from [[funding]] or attracting investors into the movie project to [[law|legal]], [[screenplay|scripting]], [[marketing]], advisory and supervising capacities.<ref>{{cite web |title=Executive Producer (aka Executive in Charge of Production)|url=http://creativeskillset.org/creative_industries/film/job_roles/3086_executive_producer_aka_executive_in_charge_of_production|accessdate= January 12, 2017}}</ref>
The crediting of executive producers in the film industry has risen over time. In the mid-to-late 1990s, there were an average of just under two executive producers per film. In 2000, the number jumped to 2.5 (more than the number of standard "[[film producer|producers]]"). In 2013, there were an average of 4.4 executive producers per film, compared with 3.2 producers.<ref>{{cite web |title=How many movie producers does a film need?|url=https://stephenfollows.com/how-many-movie-producers-per-film |accessdate= 2016-05-04}}</ref>
== Television == {{main|Television producer}} In television, an executive producer usually supervises the creative content and the financial aspects of a production. Some writers, like [[Stephen J. Cannell]], [[Tina Fey]], and [[Ryan Murphy (writer)|Ryan Murphy]], have worked as both the creator and the producer of the same TV show.<ref>{{cite web|title=In television, an Executive Producer may also be the Creator/Writer of a series|url=http://www.producersguild.org/?page=faq|accessdate = March 12, 2013}}</ref> In case of multiple executive producers on a TV show, the one outranking the others is called the [[showrunner]],<ref>{{cite web|title=There can be multiple executive producers on a series, but the one in charge is called the showrunner.|url=http://filmtvcareers.about.com/od/basics/p/CP_TV_Writer.htm|accessdate = March 10, 2013}}</ref> or the leading executive producer.
==Music== {{See also|Music executive}} In recorded music, [[record label]]s distinguish between an executive producer and a [[record producer]]. The executive producer is responsible for business decisions and more recently, organizing the recordings along with the music producer, whereas the record producer produces the music. Sometimes the executive producer organises the recording and selects recording-related crew, such as [[sound engineer]]s and [[session musician]]s.<ref name="Discovery Channel">{{cite web|title=The executive producer usually chooses the musicians and technicians for a record, decides where and when to record, and the production budget and timetable|url=http://curiosity.discovery.com/question/what-music-executive-producer-do|accessdate=March 12, 2013|archiveurl=https://archive.fo/20130410181827/http://curiosity.discovery.com/question/what-music-executive-producer-do|archivedate=10 April 2013|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
== Video games == {{main|Video game producer}} In the [[video game industry]], the title "executive producer" is not well-defined. It may refer to an external producer working for the [[video game publisher|publisher]], who works with the [[video game developer|developer]]s.
For example, in 2012, [[Jay-Z]] was announced as executive producer for [[NBA 2K13]]. His role consisted of appearing in an introduction, picking songs for the game's soundtrack and contributing to the design of its in-game menus "and other visual elements".<ref>{{cite news |title=Argent said Jay-Z's influence would be felt immediately in the game, starting during its video introduction. Jay-Z also handpicked the game's soundtrack |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2012/08/01/tech/gaming-gadgets/jay-z-nba2k13|accessdate = August 1, 2012 | work=CNN |date=1 August 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Jay-Z NBA 2K13: Rapper Announced As 'Executive Producer'|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/19079364|accessdate= August 2, 2012}}</ref>
== Radio == {{main|Radio producer}} An executive radio producer helps create, develop, and implement strategies to improve product and ratings.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.rbr.com/executive-producer/|title=Executive Producer {{!}} Radio & Television Business Report|website=www.rbr.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-03-25}}</ref>
